intents.command_syntax: Provides Unix/Linux command syntax and usage
intents.troubleshooting: Helps troubleshoot Unix system issues and errors
intents.status_check: Provides system status and monitoring commands
intents.process_management: Helps with process monitoring and management
intents.ssl_management: Handles SSL certificate renewals and procedures
intents.ticket_management: Helps with ticket creation and management processes

commands.df: df -h - Display disk space usage in human-readable format
commands.free: free -m - Display memory usage in megabytes
commands.ps: ps aux - Display all running processes
commands.find: find / -type f -size +100M - Find files larger than 100MB
commands.uptime: uptime - Display system uptime and load average

troubleshooting.Permission denied: Check file permissions with 'ls -l' and use 'chmod' or 'chown' to fix
troubleshooting.Command not found: The command may not be installed or not in PATH
troubleshooting.Disk full: Use 'df -h' to check disk usage, clean up log files or temporary files
troubleshooting.Low disk: Check disk space and send email to server owners if space occupied is above 90%
troubleshooting.Slow disk: Refer to KB0012680 for volume problem resolution

KB002.title: SSL Certificate Renewal
KB002.content:
SSL certificate renewal Procedure for IHS Webservers - ITSDUnix: KB0011230
https://www.techatford.com/kb_view.do?sysparm_article=KB0011230

Steps: Go to SSL certificate renewal procedure for Certs hosted on IHS Webservers through Jenkins Job: https://linux-gsd.ford.com/job/IHS-SSL_Certs_jobs/

KB003.title: NAS Filesystem Alerts
KB003.content:
NAS Filesystem Alerts in ITO/PHY servers - ITSDUnix: KB0010484
https://www.techatford.com/kb_view.do?sysparm_article=KB0010484

Procedure:
1. Go to https://linux-gsd.ford.com/job/Read_Only_Operations/job/df/
2. Check if the Filesystem usage status is above threshold (> 90%)
3. Send an Email to server owner
4. Hold the ticket as per priority mention below for Application Team / Server owner response.

KB004.title: Unix Ticket Creation
KB004.content:
How to create unix related tickets:

1) For requests to make changes on the server such as installing/uninstalling software, moving or deleting files, cert renewals and any other items:
https://www.techatford.com/now/sow/record/sc_cat_item/a3755f663d3492107b2c3d0acda0b300

2) To submit request to add, update or remove access for a given user, group, ftp/generic/proxy account, or sudo access to a server:
https://www.techatford.com/now/sow/record/sc_cat_item/a3ba18e34cfe0a90f832dca2f914969e

KB005.content:

https://www.techatford.com/kb_view.do?sysparm_article=KB0010319

KB006.title: Unix User ID Deletion
KB006.content:
ITSD - Unix user ID deletion in Jenkins Job - ITSDUnix: KB0011235
https://www.techatford.com/kb_view.do?sys_kb_id=45670f235955921038328b14ee7de4ee

Procedure:
1) Check the server info
2) Verify if there is approval
3) Ask user for approval from IT pri/secondary delegate
4) Once received the approval, go to Jenkins and run the job Delete_User_Account

KB007.title: Host or Monitoring Unavailable
KB007.content:
ITSD - Host or monitoring unavailable - ITSDUnix: KB0010472
https://www.techatford.com/kb_view.do?sysparm_article=KB0010472

Escalation Procedure:
- Unix Server: Forward the ticket to SNO-Global-Unix-Server-Ops
- WAS Servers: Forward the ticket to SNO-Global-WebSphere-Linux-Server-Ops

KB008.title: High Network Utilization
KB008.content:
ITSD - High Network Utilization On Host - ITSDUnix: KB0010475
https://www.techatford.com/kb_view.do?sysparm_article=KB0010475

Procedure:
1) Get the Server name from the ticket
2) Ensure if the alert is from specific servers (ltp03999, lep03994, etc.)
3) If not, forward to SNO-Global-Unix-Server-Ops
4) Go to Dynatrace: https://www.dynatrace.ford.com/
5) Check if process running are dsmserv or Veeam agent
6) If yes, email dprotect@ford.com
7) If other processes, route to Unix L2

KB009.title: Backup Failure Resolution
KB009.content:
ITSD - Incremental backup failed/missed tickets from ITO/PHY servers - ITSDUnix: KB0010479
https://www.techatford.com/kb_view.do?sysparm_article=KB0010479

Procedure:
1) Check server info
2) Verify server status and if it's a plant server
3) Go to Jenkins, Run the job restart TSM client
4) Check Output, if tsm restart fails, route to L2
5) For TSM restart success: Go to https://www.dcbackups.ford.com/
6) Initiate one time backup
7) Wait for backup to complete
8) Check /site/backup/logs/dsmsched.log or dc backup website
